Models module

The module models.py is the main and default module for our flask application consist of several models to create database tables with several constraints. This models script allows the user to create tables in the database with the given fields.

Models module consist of several classes to create tables with the constraints. This module requires the following package flask, flask_restful, flask_sqlalchemy, uuid, redis, dotenv be installed within the python environment where we are running this module.

This file models.py can also be imported as a module and contains the following:
Classes (model):
  • Users -

    The Users class inheriting from the db.model creates users table on the database with the following fields namely id, email, fullname, google_id, password and the field user_data as a relationship to the other table called ‘user_data’ to create the connection or link between the ‘users’ table and the ‘user_data’ table.

  • UserData -

    The UserData class inheriting from the db.model creates user_data table on the database with the following fields namely id, username, userage, usercity, usertype and the users_id field as a Foreign Key of users table pointing id the primary key of users table.

Functions:
  • get_uuid -

    The get_uuid function will return a random UUID for 32-character lowercase hexadecimal string. get_uuid is used in two classes (i.e. models for creating tables) namely Users and UserData for creating unique id for ‘id’ field in tables namely users and user_data

class models.UserData(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

The UserData class inheriting from the db.model creates user_data table on the database with the following fields namely id, username, userage, usercity, usertype and the users_id field as a Foreign Key of users table pointing id the primary key of users table.

id

The field id is the primary_key for the table users and with the unique constraint enabled.

get_uuid method is called for the default argument to set the id for all the rows in a table by default automatically.

userage

The field userage is a Integer and cannot be null as well.

usercity

The field usercity is a string of 50 characters and cannot be null as well.

username

The field username is a string of 50 characters and cannot be null.

users_id

The field users_id is a string of 32 characters and It’s the foreign key of the users table with the parameter of db.ForeignKey('users.id').

usertype

The field usertype is also a string type and cannot be null as well.

class models.Users(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

The Users class inheriting from the db.model creates users table on the database with the following fields namely id, email, fullname, google_id, password and the field user_data as a relationship to the other table called ‘user_data’ to create the connection or link between the ‘users’ table and the ‘user_data’ table.

email

The field email is a string of 255 characters with unique constraint enabled and cannot be null as well.

fullname

The field fullname is a string of 50 characters and cannot be null as well.

google_id

The field google_id is a string and can be null because users who are creating the account with the google account only have the google_id field.

id

The field id is the primary_key for the table users and with the unique constraint enabled.

get_uuid method is called for the default argument to set the id for all the rows in a table by default automatically.

password

The field password is a string of 512 characters and can be null because users who are creating the account without the google account only will have the password field.

user_data

The field user_data is not a column it’s a relationship field with the backref set to users table to make both users and user_data table connected to eachothers.

models.get_uuid()[source]

The get_uuid function will return a random UUID for 32-character lowercase hexadecimal string. get_uuid is used in two classes (i.e. models for creating tables) namely Users and UserData for creating unique id for ‘id’ field in tables namely users and user_data.

Returns

the 32-character lowercase hexadecimal string

Return type

str
